title: Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant Loses Power Again, Officials Say
Four Russian Missiles Strike Center of Kharkiv
description: Two building complexes used by the Ukrainian military appeared to be the targets.

title: 10 Dead in Gas Station Explosion in Ireland, Officials Say
description: A child and two teenagers were among those killed after an explosion in Creeslough, County Donegal, on Friday.

title: The Purpose of Extra-Large Marshmallows? A U.K. Court Weighs In
description: A British tribunal considered how a slightly larger marshmallow might be taxed by evaluating its taste, size and packaging.

title: Russia Names a New General for the War in Ukraine
description: The appointment of Gen. Sergei Surovikin, 55, comes as Moscow’s troops face serious setbacks on the battlefield.

title: Many Canadians Can’t Afford Homes Despite Cooling Real Estate Market
description: Even in cities that were once considered a good bet for house hunters seeking affordability, affluent households find that prices are high.

title: ‘Happy Birthday, Mr. President’: Ukrainians Celebrate Bridge Blast With Memes.
description: The bridge has both practical and symbolic resonance.

title: Children Killed in Thai Massacre Are Laid to Rest
description: The town of Uthai Sawan in Thailand, a Buddhist-majority country, began formally mourning the victims of a mass killing at a day care center, most of them children.

title: ‘Happy birthday, Mr. President’: Ukrainians celebrate the bridge blast with memes.
description: The bridge has both practical and symbolic resonance.

title: After Secret US Talks Fail, A Hidden War in Africa Rapidly Escalates
description: Months of discreet American diplomacy have failed to stop the fighting in northern Ethiopia. Now, the civil war is plunging into its most alarming phase yet.

title: A mass grave and a separate burial site with nearly 200 bodies are discovered in Lyman.
A Yayoi Kusama Pumpkin Sculpture Is Reinstalled in Japan
description: Technically, it’s a replica of the polka-dot plastic creation that was damaged by a storm last year. But regardless, people are happy.

title: Page Turners
description: Fall is the perfect time to hunker down and read deeply.

title: The Hockey Canada Scandal: Rethinking How Sports Are Governed
description: Defiant testimony from the organization’s interim chairwoman prompted a widespread backlash this week from both Parliament and corporate sponsors.

title: Egypt’s New Administrative Capital Rises, but at What Price?
description: It is the grandest in a slew of megaprojects spearheaded by the president. But as the country limps through a dire economic crisis, there are doubts about whether it can afford his grandiose dreams.

title: Crimea’s Kerch Strait Bridge holds deep strategic, and symbolic, value.
description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia presided over the bridge’s opening, personally driving a truck across the link between Russia and Crimea — land seized from Ukraine in 2014.

title: A Distracted Russia Is Losing Its Grip on Its Old Soviet Sphere
description: Russia’s domination of Central Asia and the Caucasus region is unraveling as the Kremlin focuses on the war in Ukraine — and border violence is flaring.
